thread.title: People Are Celebrating Girl Love After This Woman Surprised Her Neighbor With Flowers - BuzzFeed News
thread.title_full: People Are Celebrating Girl Love After This Woman Surprised Her Neighbor With Flowers - BuzzFeed News

author: Remy Smidt
title: People Are Celebrating Girl Love After This Woman Surprised Her Neighbor With Flowers - BuzzFeed News
text:
“Rebekah was passing by at the same time then stop to ask me what was wrong and I just choked out ‘boys’ and kept running,” she said. “We had two classes previously but we didn’t know each other very well.”
ID: 10680517 4. “I wanted to help her,” said Lambdin. So that night, she left some flowers on Dasabe’s doorstep with a note. This girl in my building saw me crying in the hallway last night and sent me these this morning
— mother of moms (@egyptique) ID: 10680683 5. The teen found the surprise in the morning. View this image › 
Rebekah Lambdin ID: 10680688 “It made me feel like someone cared. Oftentimes in New York City when people are crying you just try to avoid eye contact,” Dasabe said.
ID: 10680533 7. So many people responded to Dasabe’s tweet with a suggestion. @egyptique date her
— fuz (@skyelilac32) ID: 10680792 8. Seriously. View this image › 
@NOTODAYLIVE, @skinnyluke, @hautehoseok, @GhostBadlands ID: 10680705 9. People thought that it was a prime example of ~women helping women.~ @pinsandnoodles @egyptique a beautiful example of girls loving a supporting other girls 💪
— //Elizabeth-Rose 👑 (@lizzierosekey) ID: 10680786 10. They said “we need more girl love like this.” @egyptique we need more girl love like this
— cass (@xsadcassie) ID: 10680779 11. “How many times has a woman rescued you?” asked one person. View this image › 
@claudiachoxo ID: 10680828 12. Dasabe sent Lambidn a note, thanking her for the flowers. “Girls look out for girls,” she wrote. View this image › 
Anzie Dasabe ID: 10681074 Check out more articles on BuzzFeed.com! 
Remy Smidt is a social news fellow with BuzzFeed News and is based in New York. Contact Remy Smidt at remy.smidt@buzzfeed.com . Got a confidential tip? Submit it here .
